basics.name: Curtis Frifeldt
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Department of Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in May 2017.

work.company: Pearl Harbor Naval Shipyard and IMF
work.summary: Work with a project team to support maintenance on a nuclear submarine
highlights: Perform system checks and audits to ensure plant readiness for upcoming procedures
Read nuclear plant manuals and test instructions to show proficiency through discussion
Generate training briefing packages used to instruct ships force for upcoming procedures

work.summary: Promote a friendly venue at local sporting events.
highlights: Ensure safety for spectators and athletes by enforcing an established code of conduct
Attend to customer complaints with friendly customer service

awards.title: Dean's List: Spring 2016, Fall 2016
awards.summary: Awarded to students who receive a GPA of 3.5 or higher based on 12 or more graded credits

awards.title: Centennial Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to incoming freshmen who completed high school with a minimum unweighted GPA of 3.80.

awards.title: VEX Robotics World Championship Finalist
awards.summary: My team (1973D) won second place at the 2012 VEX World Championship.
